intro: Inversodicraea aloides, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal fynbos vegetation, thriving in well-drained, sandy soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is often cultivated in gardens with appropriate conditions.
